greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows giving successive states of cellular automaton generated by "Rule 90".
comment: If either neighbor is 1 then new state is 1, otherwise new state is 0.
Rules #18, #26, #82, #90, #146, #154, #210, #218 all give rise to this sequence. - Hans Havermann
reference: S. Wolfram, A New Kind of Science, Wolfram Media, 2002; p. 25.
link: Robert Price, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..9999
S. Wolfram, A New Kind of Science
Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
mathematica: rows = 10; ca = CellularAutomaton[90, {{1}, 0}, rows-1]; Flatten[ Table[ca[[k, rows-k+1 ;; rows+k-1]], {k, 1, rows}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 24 2012 *)
xref: Cf. A070950, A070887. Alternate rows of A047999. Interpreted as binary numbers: A038183. Interpreted as Zeckendorf-expansions: A048757. Drawn as binary trees: A080263.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 19 2002
